meanings.definition: The quality of being suitable or pleasant to live in.
meanings.sent1: The livableness of the neighborhood attracted many families.
meanings.sent2: The new apartment complex has a high level of livableness.
meanings.sent3: The real estate agent joked that the house's livableness was so great, it could make anyone want to move in.
meanings.sent4: The livableness of the city was like a warm embrace, welcoming all who came.
meanings.sent5: The livableness of the town was so inviting, it felt like a cozy hug.

meanings.definition: The state of being livable or habitable.
meanings.sent1: The livableness of the area made it a popular choice for new residents.
meanings.sent2: The improvement in livableness of the building was noticeable after the renovations.
meanings.sent3: The campers were delighted by the livableness of the forest, with its clear streams and abundant wildlife.
meanings.sent4: The livableness of the island was like a paradise, with its pristine beaches and lush vegetation.
meanings.sent5: The livableness of the village was so charming, it felt like stepping into a storybook.
